justification: “Participants completed the Toronto Alexithymia Scale (TAS-20) questionnaire… It measures three facets of alexithymia: difficulty identifying feelings (DIF), difficulty describing feelings (DDF), and externally-oriented thinking (EOT).”
“Participants completed… a Random Dot Kinematogram task (here called the ‘Dot Task’)… we used percent-correct scores to measure participants’ performance.”

measured_by: Revised Reading the Mind in the Eyes Test (RMET)
justification: “The RMET… consists of 36 photos of actors’ faces… participants were asked to identify the best descriptor for the face,” and percent-correct on the RMET was used as the emotion recognition measure.

“Our social decision-making task was a modified version of the one-round ‘Trust Game’… the amount sent by the investor is a positive expectation in the face of social uncertainty, which has been conceptualized as trust.”

measured_by: Area Under the Type-2 ROC Curve (AUROC2)
justification: “In our study, we use the Area Under the Type 2 ROC Curve (AUROC2) as an approximation for metacognitive sensitivity… AUROC2 provides an easily interpretable measure of a participant’s metacognitive sensitivity.”

“We also calculated the ratio of participants’ meta-d' to d' scores as a measure of metacognitive efficiency… representing the amount of information an individual’s confidence carries about their performance.”
